children.text: Content Standard 1: Students shall demonstrate and apply the essential skills and techniques to produce music.

Sing using proper vocal technique
  • breathing and posture
  • free and clear tone, using accurate intonation
  • articulation (e.g., pure vowels, consonant sounds)
  • dynamics and tempi as indicated by markings in the score
  • phonatory function (e.g., resonance, vocal registration, vocal production)
  • diphthongs
Demonstrate independence by performing alone or in an ensemble
Respond to artistic conducting gestures as they relate to style and interpretation

Sing moderate to moderately difficult literature with and without instrumental accompaniment
  • two-part harmony (e.g., rounds, canons, descants)
  • three-part harmony

Demonstrate and explain appropriate small and large ensemble performance techniques during formal and/or informal performances
  • balance
  • blend
  • tone color and timbre
  • expressive phrasing
Sight-sing medium to difficult level melodies in major or minor keys chosen by the instructor using a consistent method
Sight-sing ensemble parts

Demonstrate through performance an understanding of the language of music
  • compound meter (e.g., , , , )
  • mixed meter
Content Standard 2: Students shall demonstrate creative expression through music.

Sing in a manner reflecting the expressive qualities of music in rehearsal and performance including dynamic and tempo markings
  • fortississimo (fff)
  • pianississimo (ppp)
  • sforzando
  • staccato
  • legato
Compose warm-ups that address vocal problems in the repertoire being studied
Content Standard 3: Students shall listen to, analyze, describe, and evaluate music.
Design and apply criteria for making informed judgments regarding the quality and effectiveness of musical performances
Evaluate musical performances by comparing them to similar or exemplary models and offering constructive suggestions for improvement
Content Standard 4: Students shall demonstrate and apply knowledge of connections between music and other disciplines.
Exhibit self-discipline and teamwork in daily rehearsals and musical performances
Model appropriate etiquette as both a performer and an observer
Perform music literature from a variety of styles, time periods, and cultures using appropriate interpretation
Identify common elements and descriptive terms used in music with those used in other disciplines
Evaluate the role of music as a vocation or avocation
Describe the uses of music in society and culture
Explore the genre, style, composer, and historical background of the repertoire being studied
